H0.text: Virus is a structure that refers to a group of specialized cells that all perform the same function.

H1.text: Tissue is the structure that refers to a group of specialized cells that all perform the same function.

H2.text: An organ is a structure that refers to a group of specialized cells that all perform the same function.

H3.text: Nucleus is the structure that refers to a group of specialized cells that all perform the same function.

A4.text: In biology, tissue is an assembly of similar cells and their extracellular matrix from the same embryonic origin that together carry out a specific function.

A5.text: Simple permanent tissue is a group of cells that are similar in origin, structure, and function.
